sage.scene.state

Class ZBufferState

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.state.RenderState
      • sage.scene.state.ZBufferState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JOGLZBufferState

    public abstract class ZBufferState
extends RenderState
    ZBufferState is an abstract description of one particular kind of RenderState: state information associated with the Z-Buffer, also called the Depth Buffer, in a graphics API-specific IRenderer implementation. A given Renderer implementation defines a concrete subclass of ZBufferState (for example, JOGLZBufferState) and returns an instance of that class from its IRenderer.createRenderState(RenderState.RenderStateType) method.

    The state values associated with a ZBuffer include

    • a boolean indicating whether ZBuffer ("Depth Buffer") testing is enabled (the so-called depth test flag);
    • a Test Function used in ZBuffer depth testing (when enabled); and
    • a boolean indicating whether the ZBuffer is writable when depth testing is enabled (the so-called depth mask flag).

    Note that even if the depth mask flag is true, no data is written into the ZBuffer if the depth test flag is false.

    Author:
    John Clevenger, based on a similar class in JMonkeyEngine.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ZBufferState.TestFunction
      Defines the test functions which can be applied in the ZBuffer (Depth Buffer) in an underlying graphics implementation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ZBufferState()
      Constructs a new ZBufferState object with initial state values Depth Testing Enabled = true, TestFunction = ZBufferState.TestFunction.LessThan and Depth Buffer Writable = True.
